page.title: 08TRANSPORT -types
page.content: The main features of transport are the London to Bournemouth and Weymouth railway line with its branch to Lymington for the Isle of Wight ferry and the A337 road which leads from the M27 at Cadnam to Lymington. This road carries much of the private and commercial traffic for the western part of the Isle of Wight. The railway line to Ringwood, Wimborne and Bournemouth West was closed in 1964 and subsequently dismantled. Nearly every house in this area has at least one motor car and this is a reason for the fact that many people, who live in this region, travel daily to work elsewhere. A major traffic problem is the railway level crossing at Brockenhurst station which can cause long 'tailbacks' on the A337 when the barrier is down in summertime.
